title: Audit mcp.do integration
description:
Review api/mcp/ integration. Ensure search/fetch/do primitives properly expose DO capabilities. Document gaps.

## Scope

1. Review api/mcp/ implementation
2. Verify search primitive integration
3. Verify fetch primitive integration
4. Verify do primitive integration
5. Check if DO capabilities are properly exposed
6. Document gaps and inconsistencies

## MCP Primitives

- **search**: Search across DO collections
- **fetch**: Retrieve DO resources
- **do**: Execute actions on DOs

## Files to Review

- api/mcp/ directory
- Any mcp.do imports
- MCP server configuration

## Deliverables

- Gap analysis
- Follow-up tasks if needed
close_reason: Audit complete - MCP integration partial; missing search/fetch/do primitives and OAuth 2.1

title: Product: Define MVP scope - what should work in v0.2.0?
Use AnalyticsBufferDO from @dotdo/api for cost-efficient analytics
description:
@dotdo/api provides AnalyticsBufferDO - a hibernatable WebSocket pattern for high-throughput analytics at 99.5% cost reduction.

Features:
- WebSocket hibernation (95% discount)
- Batched R2 flush
- Tested to 100k req/s
- /bin/zsh.004/million events vs /bin/zsh.45/million (HTTP-only)

Currently DO has no analytics buffering implementation.

title: Create DO sdk.config.ts
description:
Define DO API surface in sdk.config.ts format. Include identity, collections, system methods. This will be used by @dotdo/sdk to generate packages.

## Scope

1. Define identity methods ($id, $type, $context)
2. Define collection methods (things, actions, relationships)
3. Define system methods (lifecycle, CDC, storage)
4. Define RPC methods
5. Configure output packages

## API Surface

### Identity
- get$id()
- get$type()
- get$context()
- setContext()

### Collections
- things.list()
- things.get()
- things.create()
- things.update()
- things.delete()
- actions.list()
- actions.execute()
- relationships.list()
- relationships.create()

### System
- lifecycle.initialize()
- lifecycle.dispose()
- cdc.subscribe()
- cdc.stream()
- storage.get()
- storage.put()
- storage.delete()

## Output Packages

- @do/client - Typed client
- @do/cli - CLI tool
- @do/mcp - MCP server

## Deliverables

- sdk.config.ts file
- Documentation

title: Add @dotdo/api functions convention for proxies/mashups/lookups
description:
@dotdo/api provides functions convention for:
- Proxies: Wrap external APIs (Apollo, OpenAI, etc) with auth injection
- Mashups: Multi-source aggregation (WHOIS + DNS + SSL enrichment)
- Lookups: Reference data with autocomplete (countries, timezones)
- Packages: Expose npm modules as HTTP endpoints
- Pipelines: Multi-step processing workflows

Current DO implementation has none of these patterns.

title: Epic: Integrate foundational packages into DO
description:
Ensure all foundational packages (@dotdo/api, @dotdo/sdk, mcp.do, oauth.do, rpc.do) are properly integrated into DO platform with consistent patterns.

## Packages to Integrate

1. **@dotdo/api** - API conventions (database, functions, MCP tools)
2. **@dotdo/sdk** - Auto-generate typed client, CLI, and MCP packages
3. **mcp.do** - Model Context Protocol primitives (search, fetch, do)
4. **oauth.do** - OAuth storage and authentication
5. **rpc.do** - RPC transports (http, ws, binding, capnweb)

## Success Criteria

- All packages properly imported and configured
- Consistent patterns across integrations
- Documentation updated
- Tests passing

title: Architecture: Missing singleton RPC connection pool in sdk/client
Implement LLM-as-Judge evaluation
description: Create AI-powered evaluation for generated content. ai.evaluate({ content, criteria }) returns numeric scores. Used to automatically judge quality of generated StoryBrands, landing pages, ads, etc.

title: Configure Fumadocs to build from root /docs
description: Update site/source.config.ts to read MDX content from ../docs folder. Ensure all paths are correct and the docs structure is properly mapped.

description: Implement List, Get, Create, Update, Delete for Verbs. Use db/collections/verbs.ts. Expose via RPC methods.

description: Write tests that use real environments instead of mocks. Use @cloudflare/vitest-pool-workers for real DO/KV/R2. Use Stripe dev environment. Use real WorkOS sandbox. Tests should fail because tests/utils/mocks.ts (466 lines) is being used.
close_reason: RED complete - tests/storage.workers.test.ts demonstrates real-environment testing without mocks. Tests use real miniflare KV, R2, and DO instead of mock implementations from tests/utils/mocks.ts. Failing tests document gaps in DigitalObject identity handling.

title: Migrate manual MCP tools to schema-driven auto-generation
description:
Current api/mcp/handlers.ts manually defines MCP tools with ~200 lines of code. 

@dotdo/api automatically generates MCP tools from:
- Database schema (CRUD operations)
- Functions config (actions, proxies, lookups)
- McpToolRegistry for custom tools

Benefits:
- Less code to maintain
- Tools stay in sync with schema
- Built-in test harness for tools
- Unified registry pattern

title: Experiments Epic: A/B Testing for Functions
description: Integrate ai-experiments pattern into functions for automatic A/B testing of generated functions. Track real-world metrics: conversion data, human feedback, LLM-as-judge scores. Every generated function should be experimentable.

description: Write failing tests for creating child DOs with  reference to parent. Tests must fail before implementation. Location: do/__tests__/children.test.ts

title: Integrate @dotdo/sdk for DO SDK generation
description:
Use @dotdo/sdk to auto-generate typed client, CLI, and MCP packages for DO. Create sdk.config.ts that defines DO API surface.

## Scope

1. Add @dotdo/sdk as dependency
2. Create sdk.config.ts defining DO API surface
3. Configure SDK generation for:
   - Typed client package
   - CLI package
   - MCP package
4. Set up build pipeline for SDK generation
5. Document SDK usage

## API Surface to Define

- Identity methods ($id, $type, $context)
- Collection methods (things, actions, relationships)
- System methods (lifecycle, CDC, storage)
- RPC methods

## Deliverables

- sdk.config.ts file
- Generated SDK packages
- Documentation

title: Function Discovery Epic: Pseudo-code becomes real
description: Implement the generative function discovery system where calling $.anyFunction(args) on a non-existent function triggers AI to: 1) Classify function type (code/generative/agentic/human), 2) Generate implementation with types and tests, 3) Test it, 4) Cache it, 5) Execute and return result. This is the core innovation of DO functions.

title: Integrate oauth.do for authentication
description: Add oauth.do as dependency. Use ensureLoggedIn for CLI, device flow for headless. Leverage secure token storage (keychain/file).

title: Implement MCP server factory (createMcpServer)
description: Create MCP server factory following mongo.do pattern. Features: tool registry Map, JSON-RPC 2.0 request handling, type-safe tool registration with JSON Schema input validation. Location: api/mcp/server.ts

title: Implement MCP three primitives (search, fetch, do)
description:
Replace current tool-based MCP implementation with the three primitives pattern from mcp.do:

**Current State**:
- DO's api/mcp/ exposes 60+ individual tools (do.nouns.list, ai.generate, etc.)
- Each tool is a separate endpoint requiring individual tool calls
- No sandboxed code execution capability

**Target State (mcp.do pattern)**:
- `search`: Query DO collections, find information
- `fetch`: Retrieve specific resources by ID
- `do`: Execute TypeScript in V8 sandbox with access to search/fetch bindings

**Implementation**:
1. Wire DO collections to search/fetch functions
2. Integrate codex.ts (ai-evaluate) for do() tool
3. Create DoScope with DO bindings (db, ai, collections)
4. Generate TypeScript type definitions for scope

**Files to modify**:
- api/mcp/index.ts
- api/mcp/handlers.ts

**Depends on**: tools/computer/codex.ts (ai-evaluate wrapper)

title: Epic 4: Collections
description:
Implement Nouns, Verbs, Things, Actions, and Relationships. This provides the entity management layer for DOs.

Tasks:
- 4.1 Collection Base (Red/Green/Refactor)
- 4.2 Nouns & Verbs (Red/Green/Refactor)
- 4.3 Things (Red/Green/Refactor)
- 4.4 Actions (Red/Green/Refactor)
- 4.5 Relationships (Red/Green/Refactor)

Dependencies: Epic 1
Deliverables: collections/base.ts, collections/things.ts, collections/actions.ts, collections/relationships.ts
Coverage: 80%+

description:
Review proxy/do.ts and sdk/rpc usage. Ensure all transports (http, ws, binding, capnweb) are properly configured. Document gaps.

## Scope

1. Review proxy/do.ts RPC implementation
2. Review sdk/rpc usage
3. Verify HTTP transport configuration
4. Verify WebSocket transport configuration
5. Verify DO binding transport configuration
6. Verify CapnWeb transport configuration
7. Document gaps and inconsistencies

## Transports to Verify

- **http**: REST API transport
- **ws**: WebSocket transport with hibernation
- **binding**: Direct DO binding transport
- **capnweb**: Cap'n Proto Web transport

## Files to Review

- proxy/do.ts
- sdk/rpc/
- rpc/ directory
- Any rpc.do imports

## Deliverables

- Gap analysis
- Follow-up tasks if needed
close_reason: Audit complete - see summary of findings and recommendations

title: Fix: Limit vitest concurrency to prevent 100GB memory usage
description:
Vitest processes consumed 100GB of memory requiring manual kill. Need to limit concurrency at workspace level.

## Problem
- Multiple vitest workers spawn without limits
- Memory usage grows unbounded
- Required killing 100GB worth of processes

## Solution
Configure vitest.config.ts to limit concurrency:
- Set maxWorkers/maxConcurrency
- Use poolOptions to limit threads
- Consider sequential test runs for heavy tests

## Files to modify
- vitest.config.ts
- vitest.workers.config.ts (if exists)
- vitest.e2e.config.ts (if exists)
close_reason: Limited vitest concurrency to prevent memory exhaustion

The 'do' tool provides secure ai-evaluate code execution with full $ SDK/client access. Based on best implementations found in mongo.do, redis.do, gitx.do, and fsx.do.

Returns DoResult: { success, result, logs, error, duration }. Annotations: destructiveHint=true. This is the most powerful tool - arbitrary pseudo-code becomes real.

title: [TDD-GREEN] Fix collection type design
description: Redesign types so 'as unknown as' casts are not needed. Use proper generics. Fix underlying type issues rather than casting around them.
notes: Removed 7 'as unknown as' casts from actions.ts. Changed ActionStatus type to use lowercase values ('pending', 'running', 'completed', 'failed', 'cancelled', 'retrying', 'blocked') to match runtime usage. Simplified base.ts cast from 'as unknown as T' to 'as T' with added BaseEntity interface. Fixed test to use lowercase status keys. 4 casts remain in test files for mocking purposes (acceptable).

title: Epic: Integrate @dotdo/sdk with rpc.do
description:
SDK should use rpc.do as its RPC transport layer instead of having its own implementation. This eliminates duplication and ensures consistent RPC behavior across the platform.

## Current State
- SDK has its own proxy-based RPC client in src/client/index.ts
- SDK has its own RPC types in src/re-exports/rpc.ts (RPCRequest, RPCResponse, etc.)
- Generated client code embeds its own call() function with fetch logic
- rpc.do is NOT a dependency (not even peer)

## Desired State  
- SDK uses rpc.do's RPC() factory for all RPC calls
- SDK re-exports rpc.do types (no duplication)
- Generated code imports rpc.do client
- Transport is configurable (http, ws, binding, capnweb)
- rpc.do becomes a peer dependency

## Benefits
- Single source of truth for RPC logic
- Transport flexibility (http/ws/binding/capnweb)
- Consistent error handling across platform
- WebSocket support with reconnection/heartbeat
- Service binding support for edge workers
close_reason: Misplaced - should be in SDK repo

title: Replace manual API routes with @dotdo/api database convention
description:
The api/routes/*.ts files manually implement CRUD endpoints that @dotdo/api's database convention generates automatically from schema. Replace with:
- Define schema using @dotdo/api SchemaDef format
- Use databaseConvention() to auto-generate REST + MCP
- Get CDC events for free
- Remove ~500 lines of manual CRUD code

close_reason: Audit complete. DOAuthStorage implemented. Minor gaps: custom auth middleware duplicates oauth.do/hono features; session encryption available but not used in DO.

title: Add OAuth 2.1 authentication to MCP endpoints
description:
MCP endpoints currently have no OAuth 2.1 protection.

**Current State**:
- api/middleware/auth.ts has JWT-based auth but not OAuth 2.1
- MCP endpoints (/mcp) have CORS enabled but no auth middleware applied
- No .well-known/oauth-authorization-server discovery

**Target State (per mcp.do CLAUDE.md)**:
MCP server must serve OAuth 2.1 endpoints:
- /.well-known/oauth-authorization-server (RFC 8414)
- /.well-known/oauth-protected-resource (RFC 9728)
- /authorize
- /token
- /register (RFC 7591 dynamic client registration)

**Options**:
1. @cloudflare/workers-oauth-provider (KV-only storage)
2. better-auth MCP plugin (SQL database)
3. @dotdo/oauth (pluggable storage, recommended)

**Implementation**:
1. Add @dotdo/oauth dependency
2. Create DOAuthStorage using DO's SQLite
3. Configure upstream auth (WorkOS)
4. Apply auth middleware to MCP routes

**Files to modify**:
- api/mcp/index.ts
- api/middleware/ (new oauth middleware)
- package.json

title: Create DO-specific MCP scope bindings
description:
Create DoScope bindings that expose DO capabilities to the sandboxed do() tool.

**Target bindings** (available in sandboxed code):
- `search(query)`: Search across all DO collections
- `fetch(id)`: Retrieve any DO resource by ID
- `db`: Database operations (collections CRUD)
- `ai`: AI operations (generate, chat, embed)
- `things`: Direct access to Things collection
- `actions`: Direct access to Actions collection
- `events`: Direct access to Events collection

**Type definitions to generate**:
```typescript
declare function search(query: string): Promise<SearchResult[]>
declare function fetch(id: string): Promise<Resource | null>
declare const db: {
  nouns: Collection<Noun>
  verbs: Collection<Verb>
  things: Collection<Thing>
  actions: Collection<Action>
  // ...
}
declare const ai: {
  generate(prompt: string, opts?: GenerateOpts): Promise<string>
  chat(messages: Message[], opts?: ChatOpts): Promise<Message>
  embed(text: string | string[]): Promise<Embedding[]>
}
```

**Files to create**:
- api/mcp/scope.ts (DoScope definition)
- api/mcp/types.ts (type definitions for sandbox)

**Depends on**: do-m3o (MCP three primitives)
